97f98e5df342.description: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC, the largest and most active early-stage fund in Southern California. Snapchat: msuster
97f98e5df342.name: Both Sides of the Table
97f98e5df342.shortDescription: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC…

paragraphs.text: In every team you need the majority of people who excel at their job functions. They are great at their respective fields whether they be marketing, sales, programming, PR, whatever. People running these job functions are also leaders — don’t get me wrong — on each team you still need leaders & followers. You simply can’t have a team of people all pulling in different directions and death by a thousand cuts is having multiple departments all moving in their own direction.
paragraphs.name: f95d
3a19
paragraphs.text: But dissenters need ideas of their own. Dissenters need facts and logic. Dissenters need to be willing to roll up their sleeves and help do the work. Dissenters need to be willing to have their own necks on the chopping block and admit that they were wrong in the end.

It’s hard to be a real leader. Decisions are never black or white, so most people fudge. The straddle middle grounds to keep everybody happy. They make compromises to try and hold together constituencies. On business decisions they want to hedge their bets so they do a little bit of everything but nothing extremely well.
paragraphs.name: e6c7

paragraphs.text: Get the Fuck Out of the Way —
paragraphs.name: 301e

paragraphs.text: And if you can’t lead, follow or get the fuck out of the way — have the decency to move on to another organization.
paragraphs.name: 362d

paragraphs.text: Leadership, as I’ve pointed out before, is about being respected more than loved.
paragraphs.name: ca9b
70ba
paragraphs.text: There truly aren’t many leaders, it’s a thankless and stressful job. And leaders aren’t always right and even when they are they don’t always win. And while leaders set direction, of course it is teams that deliver results. The leader can only point and recruit world-class people but the results are owed to the team.

Leaders have well-formed opinions that go against the grain, the temerity to sell their vision to skeptics, the tenacity to stick to their ideas when they are inevitably criticized, the resiliency to wake every day when they’re being kicked by everybody for their beliefs but also the willingness to look at data and re-chart their course when they got it wrong.
paragraphs.name: 1d6f

paragraphs.text: It was not a popular decision at all when Steve Jobs chose to open retail stores. People laughed at Google buying YouTube for $1.65 billion. Evan Spiegel was thought an idiot for not selling Snapchat for $3 billion. Netflix was widely criticized for breaking their business in two.
paragraphs.name: 14bc

paragraphs.text: Dissent is fine. Dissent actually makes groups stronger. I love being challenged because it forces me to think harder about what my convictions are. I love when people come with ideas that conflict with my world view because the conflict either ends up giving me more confidence in my convictions or helps me to evolve. Sometimes it even causes me to consider revolution.
paragraphs.name: a86b

87c8af0e3846.title: I’m curious why you opted to name 2 leaders (Jobs and Spiegel) but not the leaders at Netflix and…

paragraphs.text: I’m curious why you opted to name 2 leaders (Jobs and Spiegel) but not the leaders at Netflix and Google responsible for these tough decisions… was there any particular reason?
paragraphs.name: 52dc

a6fec4938f8.title: I’ve heard this before, and I think people confuse “like” and “lust” with love.

paragraphs.text: I’ve heard this before, and I think people confuse “like” and “lust” with love. If you are truly loved by the people you work with, then you have their respect — love is not possible without respect. Leadership is definitely about respect, and great leaders go beyond just earning respect from those around them, they are loved by those around them. Lust and likability on the other hand, are fleeting relationships.
paragraphs.name: 6fa1

735a0b562531.title: I’ve always told teams that while friction may cause discomfort in the moment, it is what drives…

paragraphs.text: I’ve always told teams that while friction may cause discomfort in the moment, it is what drives growth — particularly when you have strong, focused teams.
paragraphs.name: 6f5d

544ae0c58e0d.title: Sometimes founders/entrepreneurs mistake this as wanting to “stay nimble”.

paragraphs.text: Sometimes founders/entrepreneurs mistake this as wanting to “stay nimble”. If you have assembled a team of leaders, as a founder sometimes it’s best to set the direction and then be the one that follows. Let your team leaders lead.
paragraphs.name: 57d0

e14a3e13a317.title: We all know some slackers at work.

paragraphs.text: We all know some slackers at work. Good to hear it from your perspective. On leadership, it’s easier being an effective leader when you have good intuition, a strong character, flexible, humble, and willing to admit mistakes. It also helps to research broadly, being open minded, keen to advice, and hire an incredible team.

260d723bc8bf.title: To add to this…I think individually great leaders or just a great individual needs to know when to…

paragraphs.text: To add to this…I think individually great leaders or just a great individual needs to know when to lead, how to follow and when they need to just accept and move forward. There are a lot of leaders I have developed that don’t know how to interchange between all three and the best ones know how to take a back seat and know how to add value from the backstage.
Nice work!
paragraphs.name: db56

fd2ca95b4bd3.title: You make me think of the classic essay by William Golding (the Lord of the Flies writer) “Thinking…

paragraphs.text: You make me think of the classic essay by William Golding (the Lord of the Flies writer) “Thinking as a Hobby” and the second level thinkers. They have an idea something is wrong but don’t offer alternatives. It is worth a re-read if you haven’t read it since high school.

6b73f595df58.title: Seems like you’re talking about management rather than leadership.

paragraphs.text: Seems like you’re talking about management rather than leadership. You’re a leader as long as people have trust and respect for you, and as a consequence are willing to follow you, full stop.

a85b1ce46498.title: Leaders that have well formed opinions but show the flexibility to listen and adapt — esp to what…

paragraphs.text: Leaders that have well formed opinions but show the flexibility to listen and adapt — esp to what users are saying are the one’s that survive. Also surrounding the leaders — a high caliber team that is not afraid to voice their opinions is crucial.
